casebody.data:
STATE of North Carolina
v.
Ernest ELLIS. No. 638PA04. Supreme Court of North Carolina. May 4, 2005. William N. Farrell, Jr., Senior Deputy Attorney General, Elizabeth F. Parsons, Assistant Attorney General, Rex Gore, District Attorney, for State. Winifred H. Dillon, Susan H. Pollitt, Raleigh, for Ernest Ellis.

ORDER

Upon consideration of the petition filed by Attorney General on the 22nd day of December 2004 for Writ of Supersedeas of the judgment of the Court of Appeals, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals:

"Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 4th day of May 2005."

Upon consideration of the petition filed on the 22nd day of December 2004 by Attorney General in this matter for discretionary review of the decision of the North Carolina Court of Appeals pursuant to G.S. 7A-31, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals:

"Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 4th day of May 2005."

Therefore the case is docketed as of the date of this order's certification. Briefs of the respective parties shall be submitted to this Court within the times allowed and in the manner provided by Appellate Rule 15(g)(2).
